meanings.definition: Prepare (written material) for publication by correcting, condensing, or otherwise modifying it.
meanings.sent1: She carefully edited her essay before submitting it to her teacher.
meanings.sent2: The editor edited the article to make sure it was free of errors.
meanings.sent3: He edited his friend's text message to add a funny emoji.
meanings.sent4: The chef edited the recipe to make it more flavorful.
meanings.sent5: The teacher edited the student's paper to help improve their writing skills.

meanings.definition: Be in charge of (a film or a radio or television program) by selecting the scenes to be shown and putting them together.
meanings.sent1: The director edited the movie to create a compelling storyline.
meanings.sent2: She edited the documentary to include interviews with experts.
meanings.sent3: He edited the TV show to make the characters look like superheroes.
meanings.sent4: The producer edited the film to enhance the emotional impact.
meanings.sent5: The filmmaker edited the footage to capture the essence of the story.
